Package mrbaxmypka.gmail.com.mapPointsTrimmer.xml

Class HtmlHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • mrbaxmypka.gmail.com.mapPointsTrimmer.xml.HtmlHandler
  • @Component
public class HtmlHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    HTML processing class based on Jsoup library to parse only CDATA as HTML.

    • Method Detail

      • processDescriptionText

        public java.lang.String processDescriptionText​(java.lang.String description,
                                               MultipartDto multipartDto)
        Parameters:
        description - Receives inner text from <description>...</description> which in fact is the HTML markup
        multipartDto - To determine all other conditions to be processed on CDATA HTML
        Returns:
        Fully processed HTML markup to be included in CDATA block.

      • getAllImagesFromDescription

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllImagesFromDescription​(java.lang.String description)

      • getNewHrefWithOldFilename

        java.lang.String getNewHrefWithOldFilename​(@Nullable
                                           java.lang.String oldHrefWithFilename,
                                           PathTypes pathType,
                                           java.lang.String newHrefWithoutFilename)
        Each existing a[href] contains a full path with the filename as the last text element. Here we have to replace only the URL and leave the original filename.

      • getLocusAttachmentAbsoluteHref

        java.lang.String getLocusAttachmentAbsoluteHref​(java.lang.String oldHrefAbsoluteTypeWithFilename,
                                                MultipartDto multipartDto)
        Locus Map <lc:attachment></lc:attachment> receives only PathTypes.RELATIVE or PathTypes.ABSOLUTE without (!) 'file:///' prefix.
        Returns:
        1) Locus specific absolute type of path like: '/sdcard/Locus/photos/' 2) Relative type of path (starting with '../', '/' or folder name like 'Locus/photos/' 3) Empty String if the given href starting with 'www.' or 'http://'

      • getFileName

        java.lang.String getFileName​(java.lang.String oldHrefWithFilename)
        Extract full filename from a given img[src] or a[href]. E.g. 'files:/image.png' will be returned as 'image.png'
        Parameters:
        oldHrefWithFilename - Href or src to the image
        Returns:
        The name of the file from the given src or empty string if nothing found.
